Whether to show trivial timings by default (defaults to false)
Whether to show time the time with children column by default (defaults to false)

member.summary: The first that is created and started when this profiler is instantiated. All other s will be children of this one.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.User
member.summary: A string identifying the user/client that is profiling this request. Set with an -implementing class to provide a custom value.
member.remarks: If this is not set manually at some point, the implementation will be used; by default, this will be the current request's ip address.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.HasUserViewed
member.summary: Returns true when this MiniProfiler has been viewed by the that recorded it.
member.remarks: Allows POSTs that result in a redirect to be profiled. implementation will keep a list of all profilers that haven't been fetched down.

member.summary: Various configuration properties.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ExcludeAssembly(System.String)
member.summary: Excludes the specified assembly from the stack trace output.
member.param: The short name of the assembly. AssemblyName.Name

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ExcludeType(System.String)
member.summary: Excludes the specified type from the stack trace output.
member.param: The System.Type name to exclude

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ExcludeMethod(System.String)
member.summary: Excludes the specified method name from the stack trace output.
member.param: The name of the method

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.EnsureStorageStrategy
member.summary: Make sure we can at least store profiler results to the http runtime cache.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.AssembliesToExclude
member.summary: Assemblies to exclude from the stack trace report.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.TypesToExclude
member.summary: Types to exclude from the stack trace report.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.MethodsToExclude
member.summary: Methods to exclude from the stack trace report.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.StackMaxLength
member.summary: The max length of the stack string to report back; defaults to 120 chars.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.TrivialDurationThresholdMilliseconds
member.summary: Any Timing step with a duration less than or equal to this will be hidden by default in the UI; defaults to 2.0 ms.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.PopupShowTimeWithChildren
member.summary: Dictates if the "time with children" column is displayed by default, defaults to false. For a per-page override you can use .RenderIncludes(showTimeWithChildren: true/false)

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.PopupShowTrivial
member.summary: Dictates if trivial timings are displayed by default, defaults to false. For a per-page override you can use .RenderIncludes(showTrivial: true/false)

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.PopupMaxTracesToShow
member.summary: Determines how many traces to show before removing the oldest; defaults to 15. For a per-page override you can use .RenderIncludes(maxTracesToShow: 10)

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.PopupRenderPosition
member.summary: Dictates on which side of the page the profiler popup button is displayed; defaults to left. For a per-page override you can use .RenderIncludes(position: RenderPosition.Left/Right)

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ExcludeStackTraceSnippetFromSqlTimings
member.summary: By default, SqlTimings will grab a stack trace to help locate where queries are being executed. When this setting is true, no stack trace will be collected, possibly improving profiler performance.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.IgnoredPaths
member.summary: When is called, if the current request url contains any items in this property, no profiler will be instantiated and no results will be displayed. Default value is { "/mini-profiler-", "/content/", "/scripts/", "/favicon.ico" }.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.RouteBasePath
member.summary: The path under which ALL routes are registered in, defaults to the application root. For example, "~/myDirectory/" would yield "/myDirectory/mini-profiler-includes.js" rather than just "/mini-profiler-includes.js" Any setting here should be in APP RELATIVE FORM, e.g. "~/myDirectory/"

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.Storage
member.summary: Understands how to save and load MiniProfilers. Used for caching between when a profiling session ends and results can be fetched to the client, and for showing shared, full-page results.
member.remarks: The normal profiling session life-cycle is as follows: 1) request begins 2) profiler is started 3) normal page/controller/request execution 4) profiler is stopped 5) profiler is cached with 's implementation of 6) request ends 7) page is displayed and profiling results are ajax-fetched down, pulling cached results from 's implementation of

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.SqlFormatter
member.summary: The formatter applied to the SQL being rendered (used only for UI)

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.UserProvider
member.summary: Provides user identification for a given profiling request.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.Version
member.summary: Assembly version of this dank MiniProfiler.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.ProfilerProvider
member.summary: The provider used to provider the current instance of a provider This is also

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler.Settings.Results_Authorize
member.summary: A function that determines who can access the MiniProfiler results url. It should return true when the request client has access, false for a 401 to be returned. HttpRequest parameter is the current request and MiniProfiler parameter is the results that were profiled.
member.remarks: Both the HttpRequest and MiniProfiler parameters that will be passed into this function should never be null.

member.name: T:MvcMiniProfiler.WebRequestProfilerProvider
member.summary: HttpContext based profiler provider. This is the default provider to use in a web context. The current profiler is associated with a HttpContext.Current ensuring that profilers are specific to a individual HttpRequest.

member.summary: Public constructor. This also registers any UI routes needed to display results

member.summary: Starts a new MiniProfiler and associates it with the current .

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.WebRequestProfilerProvider.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ends the current profiling session, if one exists.
member.param: When true, clears the for this HttpContext, allowing profiling to be prematurely stopped and discarded. Useful for when a specific route does not need to be profiled.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.WebRequestProfilerProvider.EnsureName(MvcMiniProfiler.MiniProfiler,System.Web.HttpRequest)
member.summary: Makes sure 'profiler' has a Name, pulling it from route data or url.

member.summary: Returns the current profiler

member.summary: Rebuilds all the parent timings on deserialization calls

member.summary: Offset from parent MiniProfiler's creation that this Timing was created.

member.summary: Creates a new Timing named 'name' in the 'profiler's session, with 'parent' as this Timing's immediate ancestor.

member.summary: Obsolete - used for serialization.

member.summary: Returns this Timing's Name.

member.summary: Adds arbitrary string 'value' under 'key', allowing custom properties to be stored in this Timing step.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Stop
member.summary: Completes this Timing's duration and sets the MiniProfiler's Head up one level.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.AddChild(MvcMiniProfiler.Timing)
member.summary: Add the parameter 'timing' to this Timing's Children collection.
member.remarks: Used outside this assembly for custom deserialization when creating an implementation.

member.name: M:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.AddSqlTiming(MvcMiniProfiler.SqlTiming)
member.summary: Adds the parameter 'sqlTiming' to this Timing's SqlTimings collection.
member.param: A sql statement profiling that was executed in this Timing step.
member.remarks: Used outside this assembly for custom deserialization when creating an implementation.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Id
member.summary: Unique identifer for this timing; set during construction.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Name
member.summary: Text displayed when this Timing is rendered.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.DurationMilliseconds
member.summary: How long this Timing step took in ms; includes any Timings' durations.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.StartMilliseconds
member.summary: The offset from the start of profiling.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Children
member.summary: All sub-steps that occur within this Timing step. Add new children through

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.KeyValues
member.summary: Stores arbitrary key/value strings on this Timing step. Add new tuples through .

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.SqlTimings
member.summary: Any queries that occurred during this Timing step.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ParentTimingId
member.summary: Needed for database deserialization and JSON serialization.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ParentTiming
member.summary: Which Timing this Timing is under - the duration that this step takes will be added to its parent's duration.
member.remarks: This will be null for the root (initial) Timing.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.DurationWithoutChildrenMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the ellapsed milliseconds in this step without any children's durations.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.SqlTimingsDurationMilliseconds
member.summary: Gets the aggregate ellapsed milliseconds of all SqlTimings executed in this Timing, excluding Children Timings.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.IsTrivial
member.summary: Returns true when this is less than the configured , by default 2.0 ms.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Profiler
member.summary: Reference to the containing profiler, allowing this Timing to affect the Head and get Stopwatch readings.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.HasChildren
member.summary: Returns true when this Timing has inner Timing steps.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.HasSqlTimings
member.summary: Returns true if this Timing step collected sql execution timings.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.HasDuplicateSqlTimings
member.summary: Returns true if any s executed in this step are detected as duplicate statements.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.IsRoot
member.summary: Returns true when this Timing is the first one created in a MiniProfiler session.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.Depth
member.summary: How far away this Timing is from the Profiler's Root.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ExecutedReaders
member.summary: How many sql data readers were executed in this Timing step.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ExecutedScalars
member.summary: How many sql scalar queries were executed in this Timing step.

member.name: P:MvcMiniProfiler.Timing.ExecutedNonQueries
member.summary: How many sql non-query statements were executed in this Timing step.
